GapFillInput.Title: Imaginary situations in the past with if
GapFillInput.Instruction: Read the newspaper article about Jeff’s accident. Then type the correct form of the verbs in brackets in each space.

P.FONT: A 35-year-old engineer, who had a serious accident while trekking in the US, has been saved by a phone call to Manchester, England, 8000 kilometres away. Jeff Aldridge and his friend Will Foster were on the fifth day of a ten-day walk in Oregon. Jeff was trying to climb a rock when he fell and broke his leg. At that point, the two young men were about seventy kilometres from the nearest town. Will used his mobile phone to try and call the local emergency services but wasn’t able to get an answer. So he built a fire for Jeff and climbed a nearby hill from where he phoned his mother in Manchester, almost 8000 kilometres away.

Fortunately, Will’s mother was at home but at first she didn’t believe it was him. Eventually, he convinced her and within minutes, she had contacted her local police, who phoned the emergency services in Seattle. A helicopter was immediately sent out to search for the injured man. By now, it had begun to get dark and Jeff was getting worse. Fortunately, the helicopter pilot saw the fire and landed in a nearby field. They took Jeff and Will off to the local hospital, where Jeff is now recovering well.

Content.Question:
1. If Jeff had stayed|'d stayed (stay) at home he would not have had|wouldn't have had (not / have) the accident.
2. Jeff would not have fallen|wouldn't have fallen (not / fall) if he had not tried|hadn't tried (not / try) to climb some rocks.
3. They could have walked|might have walked|would have walked|could've walked|might've walked|would've walked (walk) back if they’d been nearer a town.
4. The rescue helicopter would have flown (fly) out earlier if Will had got|'d got (get) an answer from the local emergency service.
5. If Will hadn't taken|had not taken (not / take) his mobile phone, he couldn't have phoned|could not have phoned (not / phone) Manchester.
6. They would have been|'d have been (be) in even more trouble if Will’s mother had been|had gone|'d been|'d gone (be) out.
7. If Will’s mother hadn't believed|had not believed (not / believe) him, she wouldn't have contacted|mightn't have contacted|would not have contacted|might not have contacted (not / contact) the police.
8. If she hadn't contacted|had not contacted (not / contact) the police, the helicopter wouldn't have rescued|would not have rescued|couldn't have rescued|could not have rescued (not / rescue) them.
9. If they hadn't had|had not had (not / have) a fire, the helicopter wouldn't have found|couldn't have found|mightn't have found|would not have found|could not have found|might not have found them (not / find) them.
10. Jeff might have died|could have died|would have died|might've died|could've died|would've died (die) on the mountain if the helicopter hadn't found|had not found (not / find) them.
